This marks a significant instance of international collaboration in space exploration and research.

title: Watch These Gold Price Levels After Precious Metal's Retreat From Record High
snippets:
Key Takeaways

  • Gold rebounded on Thursday after tumbling yesterday, as investors kept a close eye on developments related to tariffs and the economic outlook.
  • Gold’s price rallied to a new record high earlier this week before staging a dramatic intraday reversal to form a bearish shooting star candlestick pattern.
  • Investors should watch key support levels on gold's chart around $3,145, $2,955, and $2,790, while also watching a critical overhead area near $3,500.


Gold (XAUUSD) rebounded on Thursday after tumbling yesterday from a record high, as investors kept close tabs on developments related to tariffs and the economic outlook.

The precious metal surged to its all-time high of near $3,500 an ounce earlier in the week as investors abandoned risky assets amid concerns about trade tensions between the U.S. and China and President Trump's repeated criticisms of Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell. Gold backed off its highs after Trump said that tariffs on China would likely be significantly reduced and that he has no intention of firing Powell from his role.

The price of gold has soared 28% since the start of the year, boosted by worries that tariffs could slow economic growth and reignite inflation, sending investors flocking to the safe-have asset that is often seen a hedge against rising prices. Gold was trading around $3,350 late Thursday.

Below, we break down the technicals on XAUUSD’s chart and identify key price levels that investors will likely be tracking.

Indicators Signal Momentum Shift

Gold’s price rallied to a new record high earlier this week before staging a dramatic intraday reversal to form a bearish shooting star candlestick pattern.

The recent downside move coincided with a steep drop in the relative strength index (RSI) below overbought levels, indicating a strong momentum shift.

Zooming out, the commodity has trended sharply higher since mid-December, replicating a basic Elliot Wave pattern with five distinct price swings, which is then typically followed by a corrective phase.

Let’s identify three key support levels on XAUUSD’s chart to monitor and also locate a critical overhead area worth watching.

Key Support Levels to Monitor

Further weakness could see gold’s price initially fall to around $3,145. This area may provide support near the early-April swing high, which finds confluence from the 38.2% Fibonacci retracement level when applying a grid from the last year’s December low to this month’s high.

The next lower area to watch sits at $2,955, just above the 61.8% Fibonacci retracement level. Investors may look for opportunities to buy the yellow metal in this region neat the February peak and April trough.

Bullion bulls’ failure to defend this level could trigger a move down to lower support near $2,790. This area, sitting just above the 78.6% Fibonacci retracement level, may attract buying interest around the notable October 2024 swing high.

Critical Overhead Area Worth Watching

Finally, recovery efforts in gold’s price may see the price make another attempt at the $3,500 area. Tactical traders who have bought recent weakness may see the commodity’s record high set this week as a suitable location to lock in profits.

The comments, opinions, and analyses expressed on Investopedia are for informational purposes only. Read our warranty and liability disclaimer for more info.

As of the date this article was written, the author does not own any of the above securities.

The precious metal had hit a record high of nearly $3,500 an ounce earlier in the week due to trade tensions and concerns over economic policies but fell after President Trump indicated a reduction in tariffs on China and support for Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell. The surge in gold prices, up 28% since the start of the year, reflects its status as a safe-haven asset amid economic uncertainty. Technical analysis suggests watching for k

This decision is highlighted in an FT Exclusive report, indicating a significant shift in the company's manufacturing strategy due to geopolitical tensions.

title: Quantum sensors tested for next-generation particle physics experiments
snippets: Researchers have developed a novel high-energy particle detection instrumentation approach that leverages the power of quantum sensors -- devices capable of precisely detecting single particles.
titles: Quantum sensors tested for next-generation particle physics experiments
constructiveness_reason: This story clearly highlights progress and innovation in the field of particle physics, providing empowering knowledge for those interested in the topic.
summary: Researchers have created a new method for detecting high-energy particles using quantum sensors, which are highly accurate in identifying single particles. This advancement in particle detection instrumentation marks a significant improvement in the field, offering more precise measurements.

title: Artificial intelligence tool helps predict relapse of pediatric brain cancer
snippets: Researchers trained and validated a deep learning model that can detect subtle changes across post-treatment brain scans and forecast glioma recurrence with up to 89 percent accuracy.
titles: Artificial intelligence tool helps predict relapse of pediatric brain cancer
constructiveness_reason: This story highlights a significant innovation in medical technology that could have a major impact on patient outcomes, providing empowering knowledge for those affected.
summary: Researchers have developed a deep learning model that can identify subtle changes in post-treatment brain scans, accurately predicting glioma recurrence with an effectiveness of up to 89%. This model was both trained and validated for this purpose.

title: 'Bone collector' caterpillar wears dead insect body parts as disguise
snippets: A carnivorous caterpillar species camouflages itself with dead insects so it can live safely alongside spiders, stalking their webs and stealing their prey
titles: 'Bone collector' caterpillar wears dead insect body parts as disguise
summary: A carnivorous caterpillar species has developed a unique survival strategy by camouflaging itself with dead insects. This adaptation allows it to coexist safely alongside spiders within their webs. The caterpillar not only hides from potential predators but also steals prey caught in the spiders' webs, benefiting from the spiders' hunting efforts without direct competition.

title: Awkward. Humans are still better than AI at reading the room
snippets: Humans are better than current AI models at interpreting social interactions and understanding social dynamics in moving scenes. Researchers believe this is because AI neural networks were inspired by the infrastructure of the part of the brain that processes static images, which is different from the area of the brain that processes dynamic social scenes.
titles: Awkward. Humans are still better than AI at reading the room
summary: Researchers have found that humans outperform current AI models in understanding social interactions and dynamics in moving scenes. This discrepancy is attributed to the fact that AI neural networks are based on the part of the brain that processes static images, not the area that handles dynamic social scenes.

title: Can technology revolutionize health science? The promise of exposomics
snippets: Researchers in the field of exposomics explain how cutting-edge technologies are unlocking this biological archive, ushering in a new era of disease prevention and personalized medicine.
titles: Can technology revolutionize health science? The promise of exposomics
summary: Researchers in exposomics are using advanced technologies to analyze the biological archive of exposure to environmental factors. This work is leading to breakthroughs in disease prevention and the development of personalized medicine, marking the beginning of a new era in medical science.
